meanings.definition: The framework or structure of a building or other object.
meanings.sent1: The ossature of the house was made of strong steel beams.
meanings.sent2: The carpenter carefully constructed the ossature of the new shed.
meanings.sent3: The playful kittens turned the cardboard box into an ossature for their imaginary castle.
meanings.sent4: Her support and guidance formed the ossature of our friendship.
meanings.sent5: The intricate ossature of the spider's web glistened in the sunlight.

meanings.definition: The bony framework of an animal.
meanings.sent1: The veterinarian studied the ossature of the injured dog's leg.
meanings.sent2: The scientist examined the ossature of the dinosaur fossil.
meanings.sent3: The ossature of the skeleton in the classroom seemed to be missing a few bones.
meanings.sent4: The ancient ossature of the mammoth was carefully preserved in the museum.
meanings.sent5: The ossature of the bird's wing allowed it to soar gracefully through the sky.
